thread.title: DHS computer systems reportedly suffer glitch - CNET
thread.title_full: DHS computer systems reportedly suffer glitch - CNET

author: Andrew Morse
title: DHS computer systems reportedly suffer glitch - CNET
text:
DHS computer systems reportedly suffer glitch Computer networks at the Department of Homeland Security's appear to experience a hiccup of unknown origin. February 21, 2017 1:01 PM PST PAUL J. RICHARDS/AFP/Getty Images 
The US Department of Homeland Security's computer systems are so secure even its employees can't access them. 
Employees in the Washington, D.C., area were unable to get on to some of the department's computer systems on Tuesday morning, Reuters reported , citing three unnamed people. It was unclear how many DHS employees were affected by the glitch or whether it crimped the department's activities. 
Reuters reported personal identity verification cards issued to federal employees and contractors may have been responsible for the problems. 
A Department of Homeland Security spokesman didn't have an immediate comment. Share your voice
